title: LoL OCE one of the worst gaming community
body:
I've been around plenty of different  communities online over the past 15 years, all of them have their bad eggs, or statistically speaking have their trolling, angry, childish and saddistic types.

But after giving OCE a fair go for the past 2 odd years, it's become very apparent that LoL OCE is by far one of _the _ worst in terms of attitude. Not talking about skill playing the game or otherwise (though one could argue, taking advice without thinking it's an insult to your existence, could be considered a skill that helps you not tilt and etc..). OCE just seems to have a massively higher proportion of players with insanely over the top tamper tantrums.

The slightest bit of anything they can construed as negative is taken as a very insult to their existence and they fly off the handle, feeding and insulting for the entire length of games. 
Even as little things as "i'm going for red, wait and we will kill him" is taken as "you are trash, wait for a gank" or something, which just sets them off.

Every single ranked game i've played for the past 4 weeks has been littered with these people, on my team at that, no clue about the enemy team. But it almost always results in a loss.

Another example might be that, no one ever, EVER gives honours for friendly, teamwork or helpful. Something I experienced almost every game on the NA server. If anything, stuff that would constitute a +Helpful seems to as I said before, tilt people, like trying to help someone understand a champion they're having trouble against on something they (for argument's sake) should counter.

A few of the people I play with seem to concur with this, people from NA, SEA and etc.. who have seen the differences.

Anyway, i'll leave it at that if anyone feels like discussing this issue. Because it is an issue.

replies.body:
Yeah, I understand where the OP is coming from. I recently watched one of my games that I played in early January 2015. And although it was a low elo game, it was actually very interesting to see that

* players actually didn't feed like morons within the first 3 minutes of the game
* there was no stupid excuses in all chat or flaming the opposition when someone died
* players could actually cs to a reasonable level for bronze (70 per 10 mins)
* teams would rotate to take and defend objectives (especially towers) and push out waves
* players would genuinely mean "gg" after games and not a bad word was said about the opposition

Players just had more respect for others back then. Now every game is full of self entitled kids who think that being rude on the internet is normal culture. It's pretty terrible. Even in high elo games that I spectate it's pretty bad. The worst part is they are hopeless at the game and think that being rude is fine way to make up for lack of skill!

The larger the community, the higher the number of negative players, and the more mainstream a community, the more it attracts the mindless masses that thing intent feeding is a pretty chill meme and being an asshole on the internet is funny.

What you describe is essentially the natural progression of a small tight knit community to a large and more widely inclusive one.

It doesn't mean people have any more or less respect for each other, it just means there are more (and more obvious) of those that never had that respect to begin with.

In fact, I just played two ranked games, in both game me and my duo, we lost early, we tilted and we played badly, and yet everyone was positive. We tried our best, and sure we didn't win, but the only frustration was with our bad plays (which we can learn from to get better) and not at some asshat who decided to abuse us.

The games before that we did well, and we won, and still everyone was positive. There was only one game out of 20~ recently where we encountered any toxicity. Yeah we got a little lucky with that, but it isn't nearly as prevalent as people make it out to be. In large it's negativity bias, but it's also herd mentality. "Everyone in x scenario says the game is toxic, so therefore I am much more inclined to believe it". It makes you notice teh negativity more, and the positivity less. Especially since the positive behaviour reaches the extreme heights far more rarely than negative behaviour does, since negativity breeds more negativity, but positivity is often shut down or at least not interacted with.
